Posts.Content: sunnyat12 wrote: hello all. i had a double mastectomy on 10/24. at that time went home with four jp drains. i had problems towards the end with one drain but eventually they all were taken out three weeks later. well, one of my exanders became infected and i was admitted and given iv antibioticss for three days. on the fourth day i got a new expander and yippie! another cool jp drain. well here we are at just about three weeks out and i am still outputting 35-45 ccs a day. i was told the drain will not come out untill im draing 20 ccs for two days in a row. my question is, since my first bout with seroma is still fresh in my mind, should i be concerned, what is causing this after so long and does it seem like my body is rejecting this expander as well? anyone else experience this? im thinking about having it taken out completely. (the expander) Surgery 6/6/2013 Lumpectomy: Left, Right Dx 6/12/2013, 2cm, Grade 1, 2/3 nodes, ER+/PR- Surgery 7/1/2013 Lumpectomy: Left, Right Hormonal Therapy 7/6/2013 Surgery 10/24/2013 Lymph node removal: Left, Right, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Surgery 2/6/2014 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: sunnyat12 wrote: Hello all, This may be a little gross but please forgive me because I never heard of this (neither had the RN on call with my insurance company) happening to anyone. Last night, I was lotioning my chest after a shower and a chunck of my skin from my mastectomy scar pulled off.  It didn't fall off, instead when i rubbed the lotion, I noticed a tiny bit sticking out.  Thinking it was dead skin I tugged slightly and a chunk came out.  It didn't hurt at all as I am still numb in my chest area,  but it did not bleed. I measured it at 1 cm (the nurse on the nurse line had asked).  She just told me to call my PS in the morning (today).  What is worrying me is now, I have a hole in my insicion area. To give background, I had a skin sparing double mastectomy 10/24/13 and now waiting for my exchange in March.  I had troubles with seroma and pain but other than that, everything went normal. The chunck that fell off is in the area where the skin was going to be gathered for reconstructing my nipple.  Is my skin "dying"?  Anyone else heard of this?  Waiting for my PS to call back may take a day or two. Thanks and sorry for grossing everyone out.   Surgery 6/6/2013 Lumpectomy: Left, Right Dx 6/12/2013, 2cm, Grade 1, 2/3 nodes, ER+/PR- Surgery 7/1/2013 Lumpectomy: Left, Right Hormonal Therapy 7/6/2013 Surgery 10/24/2013 Lymph node removal: Left, Right, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Surgery 2/6/2014 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Feb 1, 2014 10:44AM sunnyat12 wrote: hi maryr12. i hope you are still there. here is how my appointment went. evidently things were worse than i expected. the ps is still concerned with the seroma on my left. been dealing with it since november when i had that expander replaced due to it getting infected. he noticed scar tissue in form of the drain tube that came out january 3. then he moved to my right. he believes my alloderm has detached from my chest wall. said my right expander has leaked a considerable amount. as for the chunks of skin he explained it as skin necrosis but not severely concerned compared to the other issues. he gave me the choice of having the exchange now or take the expanders out, cut the excess skin from the skin sparing procedure and stay flat. i chose the first option. i didnt even get back to work before i got a phone call saying my surgery is february 6th.
Posts.Title: Something weird happened sunnyat12 AZ85048

Posts.Content: sunnyat12 wrote: hello all! i hope you all are doing ok. since i had last posted i have been on a rollercoaster. ive had three opinions from three breast cancer centers. all suggested a bilateral mastectomy due to multiple reasons. i am scheduled for the procedure this coming thursday. the doctors and staff here in louisville at the brown cancer center have been marvelous and has educated me more than the other ceners i visited. ive been okay for the past two weeks since the office informed me of the procedure and thanks to the center i believe im physically prepared for home care. but when i woke up, i have a new emotion. i think it is fear but i dont know why. my family has been supportive. work is being supportive, my bf is supportive, im in the hands of some of the top docs in the nation, the hospital is highly ranked...so what is my problem?! Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2014 01:08PM - edited Jan 29, 2014 01:10PM by sunnyat12 Hi Luckymother, Here is my experience.  My situatation began in 2010 when I had a lump in my right breast.  Because of my age at that time (33) they believed it was only a cyst and I had a FNA procedure done and that was it.  Fast forward to 2012, the lump had reappeared.   I went back to my doc thinking that it was just another cyst that needed aspirating.  During her BE, she found multiple lumps in both breast. I had my first biopsy.  One spot was chosen in both breast and both areas came back with ADH. My mammograms showed that I had extremely dense breast and calcifications. My MRI was a level 3  I have a strong family history of BC and in the month of July, I had the genetic testing done.  At first it was listed as BRCA2 VUS.  My aunt who had BC when she was 22 finally took the test. My status was changed to BRCA2 positive. With the knowledge of my biopsies and lumpectomy results, family history and gene mutation, I went to my first breast suregon and he advised i have a double mastectomy.  I went for a 2nd and 3rd opinion and they all suggested the double mastectomy. I had it done and the results from the biopsy from the mastectomy was i had 22 areas of ADH and one area of ALH.  So to answer the question, yes it is possible to have ADH in both breast.  Good luck to you.
Posts.Title: Atypical Dectual Hyperplasia (5)in both breasts extremly dense luckymother sunnyat12
